channel.title: ZZZ Daily Images
channel.description: Image gallery from ZZZ Daily - flat earth research, memes, diagrams, and more

item.title: Matthew 4:8 & Luke 4:5
item.description: Bilingual educational diagram comparing spherical Earth impossibility with flat Earth biblical interpretation. Top shows Matthew 4:8 and Luke 4:5 in English and Russian about devil taking Jesus to high mountain to show all kingdoms of world. Left shows sphere labeled 'сферическая земля - небиблейская / spherical Earth - unbiblical' with points A-E marked 'beyond lines of sight / за линиями видимости' demonstrating kingdoms cannot all be seen from one point on sphere. Right shows flat Earth mo...

item.title: 200+ Flat Earth Bible Verses
item.description: Comprehensive list titled '200+ FLAT EARTH Bible Verses' organized in categories on black background with gold text. Categories include: EARTH CREATED BEFORE SUN, UNIVERSE IS CREATED, EARTH MEASUREMENTS UNKNOWN, EARTH IS CIRCULAR/DISC/CIRCLE NOT A BALL, EARTH HAS A FACE (A GEOMETRICAL FLAT SURFACE), WITH A LINE NOT A CURVE, PATHS ARE STRAIGHT NOT CURVED, WATERS ARE STRAIGHT NOT CURVED, EARTHQUAKES SHAKE EARTH AND DOES NOT MOVE, EARTH IS FIXED AND IMMOVABLE, BE STILL AND KNOW THAT I AM GOD, EA...

item.title: Coriolis 1
item.description: Ski jumping meme showing athlete in mid-flight wearing blue helmet and black suit with number 3, soaring high above ski jump ramp with crowd visible below. Top text reads 'YET ANOTHER SPORT THAT PROVES THE EARTH DOES NOT SPIN 1000 MPH..' Bottom text states 'FLYING 200+ METERS WITHOUT HAVING TO FACTOR IN ANY CORIOLIS EFFECT?? PRICELESS!!' Questions why ski jumpers don't need to account for Coriolis effect if Earth rotates 1000 mph, arguing projectile motion in sports contradicts rotating Earth...

item.title: Coriolis 2
item.description: Speed movie bus scene meme showing Keanu Reeves and Sandra Bullock inside moving bus. Top text reads 'YOU NEED TO GO 55 MPH TO KEEP UP WITH THE'. Bottom text reads 'CORIOLIS EFFECT' with Snapmeme watermark. References Speed movie plot requiring bus to maintain minimum speed, humorously comparing to needing 55 mph to compensate for Coriolis effect on rotating Earth. Suggests absurdity of Coriolis compensation requirements in everyday motion

item.title: Coriolis 3
item.description: Multi-panel meme with Neil deGrasse Tyson tweet about Bengals field goal affected by 1/3-inch deflection from Earth's rotation, football field goal image, AdamsCo golf scorecard, text about world's longest golf shot 516 yards by Mike Austin in 1974, and bottom panel asking 'So did the earth speed up or slow down that day?' with Neil Lie meme format

item.title: Coriolis 4
item.description: Diagram showing globe with three numbered shooters at different latitudes with text 'Please explain them what is the exact Coriolis calculation for each of these 3 shooters, whom are all spinning at different speeds and facing different directions!' with speeds labeled: 0 km/hr at pole, 830 km/hr, 1,275 km/hr, 1,550 km/hr, 1,650 km/hr at equator, and arrow showing 'Direction of Earth's alleged spin'

item.title: Coriolis 5
item.description: Three-panel meme showing volcano eruption at top with text 'SPIN OF EARTH DOESNT EFFECT ATMOSPHERE', two hurricane satellite images in middle with red rotation arrows and text 'SPIN OF EARTH DOES EFFECT ATMOSPHERE', and bottom panel showing confused person with '???' overlay

item.title: Coriolis 6
item.description: Meme showing child looking into toilet with text 'WATCHES TOILET FLUSH' at top and 'CONCLUDES EARTH IS A GLOBE' at bottom, with CPATTERSON watermark on left side

item.title: Coriolis 7
item.description: Waterfall cascading down cliff into lush green valley with text 'WATERFALLS WILL ONLY FALL STRAIGHT ON A FLAT MOTIONLESS EARTH' at top and 'CORIOLIS EFFECT DEBUNKED!' at bottom

item.title: Coriolis 8
item.description: Scrabble board with tiles spelling 'CORIOLIS' and text above reading 'When you're playing scrabble and you cheat by making shit up.' with two Earth emoji globes

item.title: Coriolis 9
item.description: Aerial photograph of yellow excavator suspended by crane cables high above Shanghai cityscape with dense skyscrapers and streets visible far below. Top text: 'THE THINGS YOU CAN DO...' Bottom text: 'WHEN THE CORIOLIS EFFECT TAKES A DAY OFF' sarcastically suggesting precise construction crane operations at extreme heights would be impossible if Earth's Coriolis effect existed. Implies construction industry successfully operates without accounting for planetary rotation, questioning rotating Ea...

item.title: Coriolis 10
item.description: Technical diagram explaining Coriolis deflection with text from IBM ballistics program showing graph of horizontal and vertical deflection for a shot at 45 degree latitude, with formula explanations. Text explains that most ballistics programs ignore Coriolis deflection because it's inconsequential. Graph shows deflection in meters vs distance with blue line for horizontal deflection and red line for vertical deflection.

item.title: Flat Earth Model
item.description: Two-panel awakening meme. Top panel shows NASA's Blue Marble globe Earth photograph on black background with text 'I ONCE WAS BLIND'. Bottom panel shows Earth from space with bright sun creating lens flare and atmosphere gradient, with text 'BUT NOW I SEE'. Logo in top right corner. Suggests spiritual awakening or enlightenment from questioning official Earth imagery to seeing alternative perspective

item.title: Flat Earth Cosmology
item.description: Comparison meme showing two NASA Blue Marble Earth photos from different years with yellow outlines highlighting Americas. Top text: 'If you can't figure out that someone is lying to you...' Left image labeled '2007' shows one size/shape of Americas. Right image labeled '2012' shows noticeably different size/shape of Americas. Bottom text: 'Photos courtesy of NASA' followed by 'I'm not sure I can help you.' Yellow outlines emphasize size discrepancies in continents between official NASA Earth...

item.description: Blurred photograph of large container ship on ocean horizon showing atmospheric distortion or mirage effect making the vessel appear compressed and distorted

item.title: Presentation Slide
item.description: Photograph of large icebreaker research ship with red and black hull navigating through water channel next to massive Antarctic ice shelf wall, showing vertical ice cliff face extending high above ship with clear sky and distant ice formations visible

item.title: Earth Diagram
item.description: Two-panel comparison of mountain lakes with perfect mirror reflections: left panel shows Grand Teton mountain peak reflected in calm lake with autumn colored trees, right panel shows mountain range reflected in lake with wooden dock in foreground and autumn foliage, both demonstrating still water creating perfect reflections

item.title: Earth Model

Center shows flat Earth dome model with small dome illustration. Large globe Earth image in lower portion with yellow rectangular boxes highlighting areas. Bottom text reads 'NO BALL FACE LIES' suggesting deception about spherical Earth, contrasting official imagery with flat Earth alternative model

item.title: Flight 1
item.description: Meme showing airplane cockpit view with pilot looking at instrument panel and runway ahead, text reads 'ATTENTION PASSENGERS' at top and 'WE HAVE BEEN FLYING EAST FOR HOURS BUT ARE GETTING FUCKING NOWHERE DUE TO THE SPIN SO WE'RE GOING HOME' at bottom

item.title: Flight 2
item.description: iPad screenshot of NASA technical document from ntrs.nasa.gov showing page 30 with mathematical equations and Section 3 'CONCLUDING REMARKS'. Critical text states: 'This report derives and defines a set of linearized system matrices for a rigid aircraft of constant mass, flying in a stationary atmosphere over a flat, nonrotating earth.' Document explains both generalized and standard linear system equations derived from nonlinear six-degree-of-freedom equations of motion. Footer shows: 'Ames ...

item.title: Flight 3
item.description: Academic document titled 'Flight Dynamics Summary' showing Section 1.1.2 'Making assumptions' with large red oval highlighting critical text. Document lists simplifying assumptions for flight dynamics including: 'There is a flat Earth. (The Earth's curvature is zero.)', 'There is a non-rotating Earth. (No Coriolis accelerations and such are present.)', 'The aircraft has constant mass', plus additional assumptions about rigid body, symmetry, rotating masses, and constant wind. Educational/engi...

item.title: Flight 4
item.description: Aviation meme showing Airbus A318 aircraft in level flight against clear blue sky with yellow horizontal reference line. Black text panel at top states: 'An airliner climbs and levels off at its cruising altitude. For the duration of the flight, the pilot never points the nose downward to follow the earth's curve, but the plane never gains altitude. Think about that.' Questions why aircraft maintain level flight without continuous downward adjustment if Earth curves, suggesting pilots fly lev...

item.title: Flight 5
item.description: NASA Contractor Report 3073 cover page showing title 'Investigation of Aircraft Landing in Variable Wind Fields' by Walter Frost and Kapuluru Ravikumar Reddy. Right side displays Chapter 11 'AIRCRAFT LANDING MODEL' with Section 1 'Equations of Motion'. Critical text states: 'The aircraft trajectory model employed in this study was derived based on the following assumptions: a) The earth is flat and non-rotating.' followed by additional assumptions about gravity, air density, airframe, aircraf...

item.title: Flight 10
item.description: Simple aviation question meme showing commercial airliner in white livery with red engine nacelles flying above Earth's curved horizon with blue atmosphere and white clouds visible below. Text in white letters against dark blue sky reads: 'If the Earth spins east, why isn't it faster to fly west?' Questions why flight times are similar in both directions if Earth rotates eastward at ~1000 mph, suggesting atmosphere should create relative motion advantage for westward flights. item.title: Funny 1
item.description: Four-panel Anchorman meme featuring Brick Tamland character in burgundy suit and glasses. Three panels show him saying 'I LOVE SPACE', 'I LOVE SCIENCE', 'I LOVE GRAVITY' with increasingly concerned expressions. Fourth panel shows Ron Burgundy responding 'BRICK, ARE YOU JUST REPEATING THINGS NASA SAID AND SAYING YOU LOVE THEM?' satirizing uncritical acceptance of space agency claims. Credit: Nick Havok

item.description: Grid of 8 ancient civilization cosmologies compared to NASA globe: Egyptian (Nut and Geb), Norse (Yggdrasil world tree), Hindu (turtle and elephants), Mayan (dome structure), Inca (layered cosmos), Navajo (dome world), Hebrew (firmament dome over flat Earth with great deep), and NASA (spinning blue marble). Flat Earth argument that all ancient cultures believed in flat enclosed Earth except modern NASA. Comparative mythology cosmology

item.title: Other 556
item.description: A lone figure walks across the world's largest natural mirror at Bolivia's Salar de Uyuni salt flats. A thin layer of rainwater transforms the vast white expanse into a flawless reflective surface, creating a surreal dreamscape where dramatic cumulus clouds and deep blue sky merge seamlessly with their perfect reflection below. The horizon dissolves completely, leaving the solitary traveler suspended between two infinite skies in this breathtaking display of nature's optical illusion.

Nick Havok credit. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 563
item.description: Two-panel meme questioning planetary distances. Top: Nikon P900 camera with 83x optical zoom on brown surface, labeled 'Nikon P900'. Middle text: 'Can a $600 camera see an object that's 1.7 BILLION miles distant?' Bottom: Faint bluish image of Uranus planet with YouTube link. Questions how consumer cameras can photograph allegedly distant planets. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 564
item.description: 'Shoot The Moon' community event flyer with camera lens logo and moon image. Text announces moon photography dates: Monday June 13, 20, 27 from 12am-12am PST. Upload to HOAX.SPACE or email solobassjake@yahoo.com. 'LET'S GO SHOOT THE MOON!' Flat Earth community coordinated moon observation project.

item.title: Other 565
item.description: Black and white historical photo of Dr. Auguste Piccard smiling inside spherical pressurized balloon gondola with ropes visible. Text: 'What did the first man to reach the stratosphere have to say about Earth's shape? "It seemed a FLAT DISC with an upturned edge." -Dr. Auguste Piccard, 1931'. Quote from pioneering stratospheric balloonist describing Earth's appearance from high altitude. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 566
item.description: Goodfellas movie meme showing Ray Liotta and Joe Pesci in suits laughing hysterically at restaurant. Text: 'HOW DO YOU KNOW WE LANDED ON THE MOON? I SAW IT ON TELEVISION'. Moon landing hoax meme mocking uncritical acceptance of televised Apollo missions as proof. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 567
item.description: Meme with Jupiter image showing blue aurora at north pole above Great Red Spot. Below: three photos of celebrities laughing - Leonardo DiCaprio in sunglasses, Ray Liotta, and Tom Cruise. Text: 'HOW FLAT EARTHERS BE ACTIN' WHEN NASA RELEASES AN IMAGE'. Shows flat Earth skepticism toward NASA imagery. Nick Havok credit. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 568
item.description: Cat meme with gray tabby in foreground looking annoyed/defeated, black and white tuxedo cat peering from behind. Text: 'When you tell your friend you can prove the earth is a ball in 2 minutes and 2 weeks later you realize it wasn't as easy as you thought'. Self-deprecating humor about difficulty proving globe Earth. @flatearthmatters. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 569
item.description: 'Last Supper' parody with famous scientists seated at table like Leonardo painting. Einstein in center (Jesus position) in sweater, surrounded by Darwin, Hawking, Newton, Galileo, Neil deGrasse Tyson, Bill Nye, and others. Text: 'WE CREATE IT. YOU DISH IT UP AND PLATE IT. WHAT A SHAME YOU ATE IT!' Conspiracy meme suggesting scientific establishment fabricates theories for public consumption. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 570
item.description: Army Research Laboratory technical report cover page. Title: 'Propagation of Electromagnetic Fields Over Flat Earth' by Joseph R. Miletta. Report ARL-TR-2352, February 2001. ARL logo in corner. Official US military document using 'flat Earth' terminology - common in RF engineering for simplified calculations over short distances.

item.title: Other 571
item.description: Wide-angle overhead photo of large floor installation showing world clock with azimuthal equidistant projection (flat Earth map) at center. Teal/turquoise continents on green background with illuminated North Pole center. Metal frame surrounded by radiating tan floor tiles with silver time zone strips. Black and yellow caution tape border visible.

item.title: Other 572
item.description: Two-panel meme mocking astronaut claims. Top: Astronaut Tim Peake in spacesuit giving double thumbs up with Earth visible behind, text 'HI, IM TIM PEAKE, AND I'VE JUST BEEN IN SPACE FOR 6 MONTHS!!' Bottom: Goodfellas laughing scene with Ray Liotta hysterical, text 'COOL STORY, BRO'. Dismissive response to astronaut space travel claims. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 573
item.description: Person's feet in brown shoes with orange laces standing on illuminated floor display of flat Earth map. Azimuthal equidistant projection with blue/teal continents, bright white light at center (North Pole), clock hands visible. Glass surface with metal frame and 24-hour markings around edge. World clock installation resembling flat Earth model.

item.title: Other 574
item.description: Side-by-side comparison of flat Earth maps across time. Left: Historical 1906 Gleason's 'New Standard Map of the World' showing azimuthal equidistant projection with pink outer ring displaying Roman numeral time zones, colorful continents around central North Pole. Right: Modern smartwatch on wrist displaying same flat Earth map design as digital watch face with continents and clock hands. Shows continuity of flat Earth map design from 19th century to modern technology. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 575
item.description: High resolution photograph of near-full Moon against black night sky. Detailed surface features visible including maria (dark areas), craters, and bright ray systems. Tan/golden coloring with darker patches of Mare Tranquillitatis, Mare Serenitatis, and other lunar seas. Amateur astronomy moon photography.

item.title: Other 576
item.description: Surreal image of man in white dress shirt and red tie with spiral galaxy exploding from where his head should be against cosmic nebula background. Text: 'THE ONLY THING NASA HAS SENT INTO SPACE IS YOUR IMAGINATION'. Claims space exploration is fictional/imaginary rather than real. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 577
item.description: Aerial photograph of Dubai skyline with Burj Khalifa tower dominating center, surrounded by skyscrapers emerging from haze. Flat horizon line visible in distance. Text: 'WHEN YOU'RE TRYING TO TAKE A PHOTO OF YOUR CITY AND THAT FLAT HORIZON KEEPS GETTING IN THE WAY'. Humorous observation that horizon appears flat even from high altitude photography. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 578
item.description: Inspirational quote over dramatic sunset beach scene with dark storm clouds, orange sun on horizon, wet sand reflecting sky. Text: 'Common sense is what tells us the earth is flat. - Albert Einstein'. Quote attributed to Einstein about intuitive perception of flat Earth. facebook.com/fematters

item.title: Other 579
item.description: Office Space movie meme showing Milton (Stephen Root) character in glasses, suspenders, pocket protector with pens, at cubicle desk. Text: 'WORKED AT NASA FOR 35 YEARS / HAD NO IDEA THE EARTH WAS FLAT'. Satirizes NASA employees being unaware of flat Earth while working there. fb.com/fematters @flatearthmatters

item.title: Other 580
item.description: Earth from space image surrounded by dense cloud of white dots representing thousands of satellites orbiting planet. Text: 'IF THERE WERE THOUSANDS OF SATELLITES IN SPACE WOULDN'T THE PICTURE OF EARTH LOOK LIKE THIS?' Questions why satellite debris isn't visible in Earth photos if thousands of satellites actually exist. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 581
item.description: Skydiving photograph showing three skydivers in freefall against flat horizon stretching to distance. Blue sky above, brown/green terrain below with no visible curvature. Text: 'THE EARTH IS FLAT AS FAR AS THE EYE CAN SEE!' Photo credit Ashlee Webster. Flat horizon evidence from high altitude freefall perspective. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 582
item.description: Meme showing three people with hair blown back by extreme wind/force against white background. Top text lists speeds: 'WE ARE LIVING ON A BALL SPINNING 1000 MPH, WHILE TRAVELING AROUND THE SUN AT ROUGHLY 67,000 MPH, WHILE THE SUN ITSELF IS SAID TO BE MOVING AT 45,000 MPH, WHILE OUR SOLAR SYSTEM IS MOVING AT 550,000 MPH AND THE MILKY WAY GALAXY IS TRAVELING THROUGH THE UNIVERSE AT 1,300,000 MPH' Bottom: 'YET WE FEEL ABSOLUTELY NOTHING'. Questions why Earth's alleged motion is imperceptible. fb...

item.title: Other 583
item.description: Vintage color photograph of Apollo command module mockups in NASA facility - multiple conical capsules in various stages of construction, some with wooden framework visible, lined up in warehouse with 'UNITED STATES' text on finished module. Text: 'ALL THE WORLD'S A STAGE'. Science HD logo. Implies Apollo spacecraft were movie props for faked moon landings. facebook.com/fematters

item.title: Other 584
item.description: Facebook milestone celebration graphic on blue background. 'fe matters' circular logo at top. White banner reading 'THANK YOU'. Large text: '20,000 LIKES FACEBOOK FLAT EARTH MATTERS'. fb.com/fematters link in white box at bottom. Community achievement celebration for Flat Earth Matters Facebook page.

item.title: Other 585
item.description: Two-panel meme mocking NASA announcement. Top: Space scene showing Earth, Moon, and small asteroid with NASA logo modified to read 'LIARS'. Text: 'NASA JUST ANNOUNCED.. EARTH HAS A SECOND MOON!' Bottom: Photo of President Obama and staff laughing hysterically in meeting room. 'Ha Ha Ha!' and 'THEY'LL BELIEVE ANYTHING!' Suggests public will believe any NASA claim. Nick Havok credit. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 586
item.description: Astronaut performing ISS spacewalk with robotic arm, Earth and cloud formations visible below filling frame. Text overlay: 'Dear NASA, Why Are There No Pictures of Earth From Space?' Ironic/sarcastic meme questioning existence of Earth photos while displaying one. Image courtesy of NASA. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 587
item.description: Job interview meme showing female interviewer in blue top looking skeptically at male candidate with head down on desk in defeat. Text: 'Do you remember tweeting "the earth is flat we never went to the moon" 5 minutes before walking in here?' Social media posts affecting employment humor. JM watermark. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 588
item.description: Milk carton with 'MISSING' poster design. Red and white carton with Earth globe image labeled 'CURVATURE'. Text: 'Have you Seen me? LAST SPOTTED ON: NEVER. IF FOUND: PLEASE CONTACT NASA. REWARD: CREDIBILITY'. Satirical missing persons style poster claiming Earth's curvature has never been observed. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 589
item.description: Dramatic high altitude photograph of solar eclipse above golden-orange cloud layer at sunrise/sunset. Dark crescent moon with bright solar corona visible against deep blue-black sky with stars. Handwritten-style text: 'People laugh, but the Flat Earthers know something'. Atmospheric flat Earth community pride message. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 590
item.description: Radio Times magazine cover (2-8 July 2016) featuring physicist Brian Cox with long dark hair holding globe Earth. Headlines include 'Daniel Radcliffe - How I could be Harry Potter again', 'Roald Dahl - Memories of a magical father', 'Roger Federer'. Main headline: 'WHY IS THE EARTH ROUND? Brian Cox answers the big questions'. London/Anglia/Midlands edition.

item.title: Other 591
item.description: Aerial photograph of Pittsburgh Pennsylvania downtown showing rivers confluence, yellow bridges, sports stadiums, and skyscrapers. Flat horizon visible in distance through haze. Text: 'I SEE ONLY GOOD THINGS ON THE HORIZON / THAT'S PROBABLY WHY THE HORIZON IS ALWAYS RISIN''. Reference to horizon always rising to eye level - flat Earth evidence claim. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 592
item.description: David Dees style dystopia vs utopia split collage. Left: dark scene with police, surveillance drones, helicopter, 'Liberty Tax', 'FDA Approved DRUGS', pharmaceuticals. Right: bright scene with 'Harmacy Organics', natural vitamins, happy families, farmers market. Globe Earth floating in center top. Text: 'WHAT DIFFERENCE DOES IT MAKE?' Contrasts mainstream vs alternative lifestyles. DDees.com. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 593
item.description: Two dolphins leaping over crystal clear turquoise tropical water with small palm tree island in background. Blue sky with wispy clouds. Text: 'WHENEVER YOU'RE FEELING UNSURE REMEMBER... WATER ALWAYS FINDS ITS LEVEL'. Classic flat Earth argument that water naturally finds level, not curve around globe. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 594
item.description: Matrix movie meme showing Neo (Keanu Reeves) in iconic bullet-time pose with hand outstretched, surrounded by floating planets (Earth, Jupiter, Saturn, Mars, Moon), ISS space station, and Hubble telescope instead of bullets. Text: 'When You're Immune To All Of NASA's Bullshit!' Represents rejecting mainstream space imagery. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 595
item.description: NASA Juno mission celebration photo (7.4.2016) showing three jubilant scientists/staff with arms raised in victory, large Jupiter image displayed on screen behind them. Text: 'ALL THEY HAVE TO DO IS SHOW YOU A PICTURE LIKE THIS AND YOU'LL BELIEVE WHATEVER THEY TELL YOU'. Questions public acceptance of NASA imagery. @flatearthmatters. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 596
item.description: Side-by-side comparison of Jupiter images labeled 'JUPITER 2014' and 'JUPITER 2016'. Both show banded gas giant with Great Red Spot, but 2016 version has bright blue aurora at north pole. Large text at top: 'SERIOUSLY?' Questions consistency/authenticity of NASA planetary imagery over time. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 597
item.description: Trading Places movie meme showing Dan Aykroyd and Eddie Murphy excitedly facing each other on busy stock exchange floor, both in suits looking thrilled. Text: 'WHEN YOU FINALLY MEET A FLAT EARTHER IN REAL LIFE'. Excitement of finding fellow flat Earth believer in person. Nick Havok credit. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 598
item.description: Goodfellas movie meme showing Ray Liotta laughing hysterically with Joe Pesci in background. Text: 'THAT MOMENT WHEN NASA ANNOUNCES ANOTHER DISCOVERY!!' Mocking reaction to NASA announcements as unbelievable/laughable. @flatearthmatters. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 599
item.description: Desert landscape photograph showing row of wooden utility poles stretching to horizon demonstrating perspective convergence. Poles appear smaller and closer together toward vanishing point. Text: 'PERSPECTIVE IS NOT CURVATURE'. Argues objects disappearing at horizon is perspective effect, not curvature. Photo credit Josh Stewart. fb.com/aterraeplana, aterraeplana.com, fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 600
item.description: Artistic illustration of flat Earth model showing circular disc with continents (North America, South America, Africa, Europe, Asia, Australia) surrounded by ice wall ring. Blue textured ocean with waves, grey ice barrier at edges. Top-down view of azimuthal equidistant projection style flat Earth map. JM watermark. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 601
item.description: Rocket launch photograph from Cape Canaveral showing rocket lifting off with large white smoke plume, launch towers and facilities visible, ocean and completely flat horizon line stretching across background. Text: 'TRULY IMPRESSIVE PICTURE OF THAT FLAT HORIZON! THANKS NASA'. Points out flat horizon visible in NASA's own launch photographs. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 602
item.description: White coffee cup with steam rising on saucer with coffee beans against dark red background. Quote from Neville Jones: 'Whilst we sit drinking our cup of tea or coffee the world is supposedly rotating at 1039 mph at the equator, whizzing around the sun at 66,500 mph, hurtling towards Lyra at 20,000 mph, revolving around the center of the Milky Way at 500,000 mph and merrily moving at God knows what velocity as a consequence of the Big Bang. And not even a hint of a ripple on the surface of our...

item.title: Other 603
item.description: Dramatic digital art showing massive tsunami wave towering over coastal city with high-rise buildings about to be engulfed, dark stormy sky. Text: 'IF THE EARTH WAS SPINNING 1000MPH TRUST ME YOU'D KNOW IT!' Argues that Earth rotation at equator speed would cause catastrophic effects on water/atmosphere. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 604
item.description: Surreal 3D digital art showing wireframe human head/bust with globe Earth trapped inside the transparent cage-like skull structure against grey background. Text: 'THE HARDEST PRISON TO ESCAPE IS IN YOUR MIND'. Message about mental conditioning and indoctrination regarding globe Earth belief. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 605
item.description: Long exposure star trails photograph showing circular star paths around stationary Polaris (North Star) at center, tree silhouettes in foreground, purple/blue night sky. Text: 'THE NORTH STAR POLARIS IS STATIONARY AND NEVER MOVES HOW IS THIS POSSIBLE ON A SPINNING BALL HURLING THROUGH SPACE?' Questions how Polaris remains fixed if Earth moves through space. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 606
item.description: Two-panel comparison meme. Top: President Nixon smiling while on telephone with grainy Apollo moon landing footage, text 'Calls Men on the Moon in 1969, 239,000 Miles Away...' Bottom: Woman in pink jacket holding up smartphone searching for signal outdoors, text 'Can't Get a Cell Phone Signal While Camping in 2016...' Contrasts claimed 1969 space communication with modern cellular limitations. @flatearthmatters. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 607
item.description: Stephen Hawking conspiracy meme showing physicist in wheelchair with glasses. Text explains ALS life expectancy averages 2-5 years from diagnosis. 'Stephen Hawking Diagnosed at age 21, AGE 74. DO YOU REALLY BELIEVE HE HAS HAD ALS FOR 53 YEARS? If so, you probably believe his ridiculous theories too'. Questions Hawking's credibility. Nick Havok credit. IG: @flatearthmatters, fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 608
item.description: Finding Neverland movie meme with Johnny Depp and young boy on park bench, three-panel format showing increasingly sad/emotional reaction. Text: 'SOME PEOPLE THINK THE EARTH IS A SPINNING PEAR'. Mocking oblate spheroid/'pear' shaped Earth claim with emotional disappointment reaction. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 609
item.description: Black and white vintage photograph of man in work clothes kneeling while sculpting detailed lunar surface model with craters using tools, creating fake moon set piece. Text: 'IT'S EASIER TO FOOL PEOPLE THAN TO CONVINCE THEM THAT THEY HAVE BEEN FOOLED'. Suggests moon landing imagery was created with fabricated sets. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 610
item.description: Side-by-side synchronized moon photograph comparison from Jan 22, 2016. Left: Queensland, Australia at 6:12 pm showing faint daylight moon (photo by Owin G Williams). Right: Florida, US at 3:12 am showing bright detailed full moon (photo by Cass Kring). Text: 'Synchronized moon shoot'. Community coordinated lunar observation project. fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 611
item.description: Surreal image of man standing on rocky cliff overlooking curved globe Earth where ocean curves upward with sailboats traveling on vertical water surface against blue sky with clouds. Text: 'YOU SAY I'M CRAZY BUT YOU THINK THIS IS REALITY'. Mocks globe model where people and objects would be at impossible angles. IG: @flatearthmatters, fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 612
item.description: Earth from space showing Arabian Peninsula at night with city lights, overlaid with satirical text: 'PROOFS OF THE GLOBE: 1. NASA IMAGES - "IT IS PHOTOSHOPPED, BUT IT HAS TO BE" 2. PUBLIC INDOCTRINATION - WE KNOW BECAUSE A SCIENTIST SAID SO 3. POPULAR OPINION - EVERYONE ELSE BELIEVES IT, SO IT MUST BE TRUE'. Dismisses mainstream globe evidence. Nick Havok credit. IG: @flatearthmatters, fb.com/fematters

item.title: Other 613
item.description: NASA Juno spacecraft with solar panels in front of Jupiter showing Great Red Spot and atmospheric bands. Top text reads "You believe this CGI satellite is remotely controlled from 365 MILLION miles away?" with "lie" highlighted in red. Bottom text reads "But flat earthers are gullible?" Watermark FB.com/fematters and IG:@flatearthmatters. Space exploration skepticism meme.

item.title: Other 614
item.description: Silhouette of family group using telescope to observe full moon against blue twilight sky at dusk. One person pointing at moon. Top text reads "JUST BECAUSE YOU SEE A SPHERE ABOVE YOU" and bottom text reads "DOESN'T PROVE YOU ARE STANDING ON ONE". Watermark fb.com/fematters. Flat earth logic meme about celestial observations.

item.title: Other 615
item.description: High altitude aerial photograph showing bright sun with lens flare above clouds, with visible golden reflection hotspot on cloud layer below labeled "HOTSPOT". Bottom text reads "HOT SPOT PROVES THE SUN IS CLOSE". Watermark fb.com/fematters. Flat earth sun proximity evidence meme claiming local sun based on light reflection pattern.

item.title: Other 616
item.description: Young boy in white shirt holding small globe Earth in palm of hand against cloudy sky background. Top text reads "The Real Reason You Can't Feel Our Earth Spinning?" and bottom text reads "Is Because It's NOT Spinning!" Watermark fb.com/fematters. Flat earth stationary earth meme questioning rotation.

item.title: Other 617
item.description: Panoramic photograph of frozen Lake Baikal in Siberia showing cracked ice surface extending to distant mountains under blue sky. Vehicle visible on ice. Top text reads "LAKE BAIKAL, SIBERIA IS NEARLY 400 MILES LONG" and bottom text reads "WHEN FROZEN OVER IT SHOULD HAVE ALMOST 20 MILES OF CURVATURE". Watermark fb.com/fematters. Flat earth curvature challenge meme.

item.title: Other 618
item.description: Satirical meme showing stacks of US dollar bills with modified NASA logo reading "CROOKS" in center. Top text asks "WHAT'S THE INCENTIVE TO LIE?" and bottom text states "NASA BUDGET FOR 2016 $52,876,712 PER DAY". Watermark fb.com/fematters. Flat earth meme questioning NASA funding and motives.

item.title: Other 619
item.description: Two-panel comparison meme. Top: silhouette of kayaker on calm ocean at sunset with flat horizon line, text reads "It's called a 'horizon' because it's a horizontal line". Bottom: curved Earth from space showing Europe with sun, text reads "and not 'curvizon'". Watermarks fb.com/aterraeplana, aterraeplana.com, fb.com/fematters. Flat earth etymology wordplay meme.

item.title: Other 620
item.description: Artistic photograph of person in gray hoodie doing tai chi pose in shallow water next to tall balanced rock cairns/stone stacks against misty background. Text reads "THE EARTH IS FLAT AND MOTIONLESS". Watermark @flatearthmatters and fb.com/fematters. Flat earth meditation zen aesthetic meme suggesting stationary Earth.

item.title: Other 621
item.description: Stunning landscape photograph showing expansive green rolling hills under dramatic sky with golden sunbeams breaking through dark clouds at sunset. Top text reads "THE FLAT EARTH REALITY" and bottom text reads "IS WHAT YOUR EYES ACTUALLY SEE". Watermark fb.com/fematters. Flat earth visual perception meme.

item.title: Other 622
item.description: Aerial photograph from airplane window showing view of countryside with green fields, clouds, and orange aircraft engine visible. Perspective grid lines overlaid on image converging at vanishing point on horizon demonstrating one-point perspective. Watermark "AWEBSTER". Flat earth perspective analysis image.

item.title: Other 623
item.description: Kermit the Frog sipping tea meme format. Kermit holds Lipton tea cup with skeptical expression. Top text reads "SEEING A GLOBE EARTH ON THE INTERNET DOESN'T PROVE THE EARTH IS A GLOBE" and bottom text reads "IT PROVES THAT YOU SAW A GLOBE EARTH ON THE INTERNET". Watermark fb.com/fematters. Flat earth skepticism meme using popular "But That's None of My Business" format.

item.title: Other 624
item.description: Aerial photograph of Nile River winding through green African landscape. Top text reads "THE NILE - A RIVER THAT FLOWS NORTH OVER 4,000 MILES AGAINST THE SUPPOSED CURVE OF THE GLOBE. THIS IMPOSSIBILITY FURTHER PROVES THE EARTH IS FLAT AND WATER ALWAYS FLOWS DOWNHILL TO FIND ITS LEVEL". Bottom text reads "DE-NIAL - WHEN YOU CAN'T ACCEPT THIS FACT AND CHOOSE TO BELIEVE YOU LIVE ON A GIANT SPINNING BALL". Credit Nick Havok. Watermark fb.com/fematters. Flat earth water level proof meme with wordp...

item.title: Other 625
item.description: Dramatic seascape photograph showing calm ocean extending to flat horizon with mountains visible on right side. Sun rays (crepuscular rays) breaking through dark clouds creating golden light reflection on water surface. Natural ocean horizon photograph demonstrating level water and localized sunlight.

item.title: Other 626
item.description: Multi-panel composite showing panoramic horizon views from different altitudes - high altitude space view, aircraft view, ground level plains, and coastal cityscape. All panels show flat horizon at eye level. Text reads "THE HORIZON ALWAYS RISES TO THE EYE LEVEL OF THE OBSERVER". Watermark fb.com/fematters. Flat earth horizon eye level proof demonstration.

item.title: Other 627
item.description: Stunning aerial photograph of Mediterranean coastline showing curved bay with coastal city, cargo ships in calm blue water, mountains in background. Dramatic crepuscular rays (sunbeams) breaking through dark storm clouds creating localized spotlight effect on water surface. Natural light phenomenon demonstration.

item.title: Other 628
item.description: Silhouette of small child standing on glass observation deck overlooking illuminated city lights at night/dusk (appears to be Skydeck Chicago or similar). Text reads "If an adult had never told you the Earth was a ball, would such an idea have ever crossed your mind?" Flat earth indoctrination questioning meme about childhood beliefs.

item.title: Other 629
item.description: Halloween jack-o-lantern pumpkin carved with glowing orange text reading "the Earth is Flat" lit from inside in dark setting. Creative flat earth holiday decoration photograph showing carved pumpkin art.

item.title: Other 630
item.description: Black and white photograph of three Apollo astronauts in spacesuits posing in "see no evil, hear no evil, speak no evil" poses - one covering mouth, one covering eyes, one covering ears. Moon surface backdrop visible. Text reads "SEE NO EVIL, HEAR NO EVIL, SPEAK NO EVIL". Watermark fb.com/fematters. Moon landing conspiracy meme suggesting astronaut secrecy.

item.title: Other 631
item.description: Hand-drawn pen and ink cartoon showing couple at dinner table with giant elephant behind them labeled "FLAT EARTH" on its belly. Caption reads "WHAT ELEPHANT?" Artist signature "KANEY" dated 9-25-16. Elephant in the room metaphor cartoon about flat earth awareness and denial. Political cartoon style illustration.

item.title: Other 632
item.description: Satirical image showing classical painting of God figure in robes floating in colorful space nebula with gorilla and Earth visible. Parody Bible verse text reads "IN THE BEGINNING THERE WAS NOTHING AND NOTHING SAID, 'LET THERE BE BIG BANG!' AND THERE WAS MASS" followed by "THEN MASS FORMED AN APE IN THE IMAGE OF STAR DUST AND PLACED HIM ON A SPINNING PEAR ROCK FLOATING IN A MASSIVE SPACE VACUUM AND IT WAS GOOD. ~ BOOK OF GRAVITY 33:13". Big bang evolution satire meme mocking secular cosmology.

item.title: Other 633
item.description: Two-panel zoom comparison photograph from beach. Top panel labeled "Zoomed out" shows beach scene with people and distant object barely visible on horizon. Bottom panel labeled "Zoomed in" reveals large hotel/casino building (appears to be Beau Rivage in Mississippi) that was hidden by perspective. Flat earth zoom proof demonstration claiming distant objects can be brought back into view with magnification.

item.title: Other 634
item.description: NASA photograph showing Apollo 11 lunar module descending toward gray moon surface against black space background. Top text reads "THE VERY FIRST MOON LANDING OF APOLLO 11" and bottom text asks "SO WHO TOOK THIS PICTURE?" Credit Nick Havok. Moon landing skepticism meme questioning photography logistics of first lunar landing.

item.title: Other 635
item.description: Close-up photograph of astronaut in spacesuit with reflective helmet visor showing Earth reflection, floating in space with stars and Earth's atmosphere visible. Quote text reads "If you find from your own experience that something is a fact and it contradicts what some authority has written down, then you must abandon the authority and base your reasoning on your own findings." ~ Leonardo da Vinci. Watermark fb.com/fematters. Independent thinking quote meme.

item.title: Other 636
item.description: Parody NASA logo on black background with blue sphere containing stars and white orbital ring, red swoosh across center. Instead of 'NASA' text reads 'LIARS' in bold white letters. Top text: 'RESEARCH FLAT EARTH'. Bottom text: 'FLAT EARTH MATTERS'. Satirical image accusing NASA of deception about Earth's shape, using modified space agency branding to promote flat Earth research

item.title: Other 637
item.description: Cartoon illustration of cute anthropomorphized Earth and Moon characters holding hands in space orbit, Moon wearing "Scumbag Steve" cap. Top text reads "DON'T LET GO!" and bottom text reads "I CAN'T, GRAVITY IS MAGIC!" Watermark fb.com/fematters. Satirical meme mocking gravity theory as unexplained force keeping Moon in orbit around Earth.

item.title: Other 638
item.description: Diagram showing three arrangements of building blocks: flat row (marked "OBSERVABLE" with green check), slightly curved arrangement (marked "OBSERVABLE" with red X), and spherical ball shape (marked "OBSERVABLE" with red X). Text box reads "No Curvature = No Globe". Watermark fb.com/aterraeplana and aterraeplana.com. Visual argument that curvature should be observable if Earth were spherical.

item.title: Other 639
item.description: High altitude aerial photograph of Tokyo metropolitan area showing vast urban sprawl with river winding through city, snow-capped Mount Fuji visible in distance on flat horizon line. Atmospheric haze visible. No text overlay. Demonstrates flat horizon and long-distance visibility used in flat earth arguments.

item.title: Other 640
item.description: Two-panel comparison meme. Top: woman with glasses looking surprised at desktop globe showing Australia, text "THERE ARE 2 TYPES OF PEOPLE - THOSE WHO THINK WE LIVE ON A GIANT BALL". Bottom: silhouette of person meditating on beach at sunset with flat horizon, text "AND THOSE WHO THINK". Credit Nick Havok. Watermark fb.com/fematters. Flat earth awakening vs globe believer comparison meme.

item.title: Other 641
item.description: Six-panel meme using chihuahua dog "Lily Lu" reaction format. Left column shows three Earth models: globe Earth (angry dog), pear-shaped Earth (very angry dog), flat Earth dome model (happy smiling dog). Watermark fb.com/fematters. Humorous flat earth approval meme showing preference for flat earth model over globe and pear shapes.

item.title: Other 642
item.description: NASA Blue Marble style image of Earth from space showing clouds, oceans, and continents against black background. Top text reads "IT'S 2017" and bottom text reads "AND WE STILL DON'T HAVE A REAL PICTURE OF THE GLOBE EARTH". Credit Nick Havok. Meme claiming all Earth photos from space are CGI composites, not real photographs.

item.title: Other 643
item.description: Moody seascape photograph showing dark gray ocean extending to flat horizon under dramatic overcast sky with heavy clouds. White bold text at bottom reads 'FLAT EARTH MATTERS'. Image demonstrates perfectly level ocean horizon with no visible curvature, used to support flat Earth claims about water always finding level

item.title: Other 644
item.description: "Internet Husband" meme format showing man at computer in blue lighting with woman behind him. Top text reads "HONEY ARE YOU COMING TO BED?" and bottom text reads "AFTER I FIGURE OUT IF THE EARTH IS REALLY FLAT". Popular meme format depicting late-night flat earth research obsession.

item.title: Other 645
item.description: Lightbulb illuminating tiled wall in darkness demonstrating localized light spread. Top text reads "IF THE EARTH IS FLAT WHY DON'T WE SEE SUNLIGHT 24 HOURS A DAY?" Middle text: "THE SAME REASON WHY THIS LIGHTBULB CAN'T ILLUMINATE THE ENTIRE WALL". Bottom text with flat earth dome diagram: "THE LIGHT IS SMALL & LOCALIZED". Credit Nick Havok. Flat earth local sun theory explanation using lightbulb analogy.

item.title: Other 646
item.description: Photograph of man with gray hair and beard standing on highway overpass holding large sign reading "EARTH IS FLAT RESEARCH IT" with freeway, cars, and highway signs visible in background at sunset. Real-world flat earth activism photograph showing public demonstration.

item.title: Other 647
item.description: High altitude photograph showing Earth's horizon with sun starburst, blue atmospheric glow, and flat horizon line from edge of space. Top text reads "HOW DID I BECOME A FLAT EARTHER?" and bottom text reads "I STOPPED BELIEVING WHAT THEY TOLD ME AND LOOKED AT THE EVIDENCE FOR MYSELF". Watermark fb.com/fematters. Flat earth awakening meme about independent research and critical thinking.

item.title: Other 648
item.description: SpongeBob SquarePants "Imagination" rainbow meme format showing SpongeBob with hands raised creating rainbow arc. Text reads "THE ONLY THING NASA EVER SENT INTO SPACE IS YOUR IMAGINATION". Popular cartoon meme format used for flat earth NASA skepticism satire.

item.title: Other 649
item.description: Black and white photograph of Al Pacino as Tony Montana from Scarface movie lighting cigar. Top text reads "YEA, IM IN A CULT" and bottom text reads "WE BRAINWASH PEOPLE TO THINK FOR THEMSELVES". Ironic flat earth meme responding to cult accusations by emphasizing independent thinking.

item.title: Other 650
item.description: Vintage collage art showing young boy in bow tie looking at wireframe globe with geometric cube overlay, mountains in background. Text questions: "How old were you?" "When They told you it was A Ball?" "Did they present evidence?" "Or did they show you cartoons?" Flat earth childhood indoctrination questioning meme with surrealist aesthetic.

item.title: Other 651
item.description: Blue gradient background with white text and emojis. Text reads "We are taking our earth back!" with sunrise emoji, followed by "Eight inches per squared mile at a time" with yin-yang emoji. Reference to flat earth curvature formula (8 inches per mile squared) used to calculate expected earth curvature.

item.title: Other 652
item.description: Two-panel meme. Top: NASA TRAPPIST-1 artist rendering showing 7 exoplanets orbiting red dwarf star with text "NASA JUST DISCOVERED 7 NEW PLANETS". Bottom: Xzibit laughing with text "YEAH RIGHT DOG, THEY DON'T EVEN HAVE A PICTURE OF EARTH". Credit Nick Havok. Flat earth meme mocking NASA exoplanet discoveries while questioning Earth imagery.

item.title: Other 653
item.description: Diagram comparing sphere horizon vs flat plane. Top shows curved sphere surface with person standing on top, horizon below eye level line. Bottom shows flat plane with horizon at eye level marked by red line and checkered floor grid. Text reads "IT DOESN'T MATTER HOW LARGE A SPHERE IS - A SLOPING HORIZON WILL NEVER RISE TO EYE LEVEL". Credit Nick Havok. Flat earth horizon eye level argument illustration.

item.title: Other 654
item.description: Kermit the Frog sipping Lipton tea "But That's None of My Business" meme format. Top text reads "ALL PICTURES OF SATELLITES ARE CGI" and bottom text reads "BUT THAT'S NONE OF MY BUSINESS". Popular meme format used for flat earth satellite skepticism claim.

item.title: Other 655
item.description: "Roll Safe" thinking meme showing man in black leather jacket pointing to temple with knowing expression. Text reads "The Earth can't be a ball if there's no curvature". Watermark fb.com/fematters. Popular "smart thinking" meme format used for flat earth curvature argument.

item.title: Other 656
item.description: NASA Blue Marble Earth image showing North America with clouds against black space background. Top text reads "The Only People Who Are Mad At You For Speaking The Truth Are Those Who Are Living A Lie". Center text: "YOUR WORLD IS PHOTOSHOPPED". Bottom quote: '"It is photoshopped but it has to be" says Data Visualizer and designer Robert Simmon, "Mr Blue Marble" (NASA)'. Text "Flat Earth Matters" at bottom. Meme citing NASA designer admission about composite Earth images.

item.title: Other 657
item.description: Four adorable orange tabby kittens sitting together on tree branch with purple flowers in background. Top text reads "KITTENS MAKE LIFE WORTH LIVING" and bottom text reads "LIKE AND SHARE IF YOU AGREE THE EARTH IS FLAT AND MOTIONLESS". Humorous flat earth engagement bait meme using cute cat photos.

item.title: Other 658
item.description: Sad Pepe the Frog meme with tears streaming down face. Text reads "When you know the earth is flat but you can't like my posts because you can't risk your friends & family knowing who you really are". Watermark fb.com/fematters. Relatable meme about flat earth believers hiding beliefs on social media due to social stigma.

item.title: Other 659
item.description: Two-panel comparison image. Top: Woman taking selfie on Bolivian salt flats (Salar de Uyuni) with wide-angle fisheye lens creating curved horizon distortion. Bottom: High altitude photograph showing Earth's horizon from space. Quote: "There are three classes of people: those who see. Those who see when they are shown. Those who do not see." - Leonardo da Vinci. Meme comparing lens distortion to space photography curvature.

item.title: Other 660
item.description: Scenic photograph of balanced rock cairns/stone stacks on lakeshore at sunset with mountains in background and calm water reflection. Top text reads "WOULD THIS BE POSSIBLE IF THE EARTH WERE SPINNING 1000 MPH" and bottom text reads "WHILE ORBITING THE SUN AT 67,000 MPH?" Watermark "FLAT EARTH MATTERS". Meme questioning Earth's rotation using delicate rock balance as evidence.

item.title: Other 661
item.description: Comic book style illustration of person pulling open dress shirt Superman-style to reveal black t-shirt underneath with "FLAT EARTH" text in bold white letters. Superhero identity reveal artistic style. Flat earth pride/coming out concept artwork.

item.title: Other 662
item.description: Five-panel meme about propulsion. Panel 1: Airplane with text "Airplane thrust pushes off air". Panel 2: Submarine with text "Submarines push off water". Panel 3: Speedboat with text "Boats push off water too". Panel 4: Space shuttle with text "What does the space shuttle push off?" Panel 5: Ancient Aliens guy (Giorgio Tsoukalos) with wild hair and text "IMAGINATION!" with History.com logo. Space vacuum propulsion skepticism meme.

item.title: Other 663
item.description: NASA Blue Marble style image of Earth from space showing Asia, Australia, and Pacific Ocean with clouds against black background. Top text reads "I USED TO THINK NASA'S PICTURES OF EARTH WERE UNBELIEVABLE" and bottom text reads "TURNS OUT, I WAS RIGHT". Watermark fb.com/fematters. Wordplay meme suggesting NASA Earth images are literally not believable/fake.

item.title: Other 664
item.description: Three-panel police officer meme. Panel 1: Officer at car window says "Sir, this spot is for the handicapped." Panel 2: Driver holds pear-shaped globe ornament and says "Water sticks to spinning pears." Panel 3: Officer apologizes "Sorry to bother you, have a nice day!" Watermark fb.com/aterraeplana. Satirical flat earth meme mocking pear-shaped Earth theory and gravity.

item.title: Other 665
item.description: Diagram showing four connected glass vessels of different shapes (fishbowls, vases) containing water at same level, demonstrating water finding its level. Top text explains "IF THE NATURAL PHYSICS OF WATER IS TO FIND AND MAINTAIN ITS LEVEL. AND LARGE BODIES OF WATER NEED TO BE CONTAINED AND DO NOT CONFORM TO THE EXTERIOR OF SHAPES OR OBJECTS. AND 71% OF EARTH'S SURFACE IS COVERED IN WATER..." Bottom text asks "HOW CAN YOU BE LIVING ON SPINNING BALL COVERED WITH WATER?" Flat earth water level ...

item.title: Other 666
item.description: Surreal artistic photograph showing person in business attire walking on flat landscape holding strings attached to planets floating like balloons (Jupiter, Saturn, Mars, Moon, etc.). Title "IMAGINATION" at top with dictionary definition below: "im·ag·i·na·tion - the faculty or action of forming new ideas, or images or concepts of external objects not present to the senses". Meme suggesting planets and space are imaginary concepts.

item.title: Other 667
item.description: Macro photography of water droplets on green leaf with flower reflection visible in droplets, colorful bokeh background. Top text reads "THIS IS NOT PROOF THAT THE OCEANS ARE CURVING" and bottom text reads "IT'S A DESPERATE ATTEMPT". Flat earth meme dismissing surface tension and water droplet curvature as evidence for curved oceans.

item.title: Other 668
item.description: Two-panel diagram. Top: High altitude balloon with parachute in stratosphere with text "ON A SPINNING GLOBE HIGH ALTITUDE BALLOONS AND AMATEUR ROCKETS SHOULD NEVER STAY OVER THE SAME PLACE" and "CENTRIPETAL FORCE HAS NEVER BEEN OBSERVED". Bottom: Globe diagram showing atmosphere layers (Troposphere to Exosphere) with speeds from 1000 MPH at surface to 1125 MPH at exosphere, text reads "THE HIGHER YOU GO THE FASTER THE AIR SHOULD MOVE NO MATTER THE CHANGE IN DENSITY". Flat earth atmosphere rot...

item.title: Other 669
item.description: Black and white vintage photograph of bald man surrounded by crowd pointing many microphones at him aggressively. Top text reads "WHEN YOU MENTION THE EARTH IS FLAT" and bottom text reads 'AROUND "INTELLECTUALS"'. Watermark fb.com/fematters. Meme about hostile reactions from academics when discussing flat earth.

item.title: Other 670
item.description: Artistic flat earth disc map with dramatic water splashing on left side and fire/flames on right side. Antarctica ice wall visible around edge with North Pole at center. Top text reads "REAL TRUTHERS RESEARCH FLAT EARTH" and bottom text reads "BECAUSE THE TRUTH FEARS NO INVESTIGATION". Watermark fb.com/fematters. Dramatic flat earth promotional image encouraging research.

item.title: Other 671
item.description: Great Lakes System Profile cross-section diagram showing elevation of all Great Lakes (Superior, Michigan, Huron, Erie, Ontario) and St. Lawrence River over 2,212 miles total distance. Title "DID YOU KNOW? Over a distance of 2,212 miles" with calculation showing "The Earth should curve 3,041,640 feet (In case you wondered, that's 576 miles)". Watermark fb.com/fematters. Flat earth curvature calculation diagram using Great Lakes water levels as evidence.

item.title: Other 672
item.description: Educational-style diagram titled "Why gravity is just a theory" showing spinning globe Earth with rotation speeds (250 mph to 1000 mph), centrifugal force formulas (F=mv²/r), stick figures being flung off, and gravity equations. Bottom shows flat earth disc model with text "You don't get this bollocks with a flat earth!" Flat earth meme questioning gravity and centrifugal force physics.

item.title: Other 673
item.description: South Park cartoon character Towelie (purple towel with red eyes) looking intoxicated. Top text reads "MAN I'M SO HIGH RIGHT NOW" and bottom text reads "I THINK I CAN FEEL THE EARTH SPINNIN'". Humorous flat earth meme using popular cartoon character to joke that only intoxicated people claim to feel Earth's rotation.

item.title: Other 674
item.description: Technical diagram titled "PYTHAGOREAN PROOF OF CURVATURE FOR A BALL WITH A RADIUS OF 3959 MILES (USING AutoCAD 2015 WITH 15-DIGIT PRECISION)". Shows Earth cross-section with trigonometry calculations, drop table showing curvature in miles/feet/inches for distances 1-3959 miles, and 10X/100X magnification views of curve. Credit M. Kahnke 07/02/15. Flat earth mathematical curvature reference chart.

item.title: Other 675
item.description: Long exposure star trail photograph showing concentric circular light trails around Polaris (North Star) with silhouetted trees in foreground. Top text reads "THIS IS IMPOSSIBLE TO FILM FROM A SPINNING BALL EARTH". Bottom text explains "THE CAMERA WOULD NOT STAY FIXED ON THE NORTH STAR & IT WOULD LOSE ALIGNMENT AS SOON AS THE EARTH ROTATED" followed by "GAME OVER GLOBE" in red stylized text. Credit Nick Havok. Star trail photography used as flat earth evidence.

item.title: Other 676
item.description: Young student in white lab coat and glasses pointing at green chalkboard in classroom. Handwritten text on board reads "it doesn't matter what we were taught, it's what we can prove by ourselves." Watermark fb.com/aterraeplana. Flat earth independent thinking and self-verification quote meme.

item.title: Other 677
item.description: Digital fractal art showing flat earth map in spiral/flower pattern with continents visible in blue and green colors, surrounded by geometric waves. Text reads "HAPPY NEW YEAR 2016". Credit Ashlee Ellegard Webster. Artistic flat earth New Year celebration graphic with mathematical spiral design.

item.title: Other 678
item.description: Two-panel comparison meme. Top: NASA astronauts performing spacewalk outside ISS with Earth visible below, text reads "THERE'S A REASON WHY NASA NEVER PANS ITS CAMERAS 360° WHILE FILMING..." Bottom: Black and white behind-the-scenes photo of TV sitcom set showing cameras, crew, and living room set, text reads 'IN TELEVISION CIRCLES IT'S CALLED THE "4TH WALL"'. Watermark fb.com/fematters. Meme suggesting ISS footage is filmed on a set like TV shows.

item.title: Other 679
item.description: Photograph of NASA Kennedy Space Center entrance showing large blue spherical NASA logo/meatball sign with space shuttle and rocket boosters visible in background. Top text reads "THE ONLY THING NASA HAS EVER SENT INTO SPACE" and bottom text reads "IS YOUR IMAGINATION". Watermark fb.com/fematters. Flat earth NASA skepticism meme at Kennedy Space Center visitor complex.

item.title: Other 680
item.description: Close-up photograph of hand holding Snapple bottle cap showing inside lid with fake "Real Fact" #783 reading "The Earth is flat and stationary. Get all the 'Real Facts' at snapple.com". Humorous edited/fake Snapple fact image used for flat earth meme. Credit JM.

item.title: Other 681
item.description: Photograph of elderly Buzz Aldrin (Apollo 11 astronaut) wearing gray t-shirt with NASA-style logo reading "GET YOUR ASS TO MARS". Added text at top reads "GET YOUR ASS TO THE MOON FIRST". Moon landing skepticism meme suggesting astronauts never went to Moon before promoting Mars missions.

item.title: Other 682
item.description: Photograph of The Denver Post newspaper front page dated Friday, July 7, 2017. Main headline under "CONSPIRACY THEORY" section reads "Around here, they think the Earth is flat" with photo of people at flat earth meetup. Real newspaper coverage of flat earth movement gaining mainstream media attention.

item.title: Other 683
item.description: NASA photograph of International Space Station (ISS) with solar panels extended, floating above Earth with clouds and blue ocean visible below. Top text reads "PAY ATTENTION!" and bottom text asks "IS THERE A CAMERA STATIONED ABOVE THE ISS? REALLY?" Meme questioning how external ISS photographs are taken, implying CGI or fakery.

item.title: Other 684
item.description: Three-panel meme with Buzz Aldrin making increasingly skeptical facial expressions. Panel 1: Multiple NASA Blue Marble images from different years (1975-2007), text "EARTH IS PEAR SHAPED, YOU JUST CAN'T TELL". Panel 2: Flat horizon seascape, text "THERE'S CURVATURE, YOU'RE JUST TOO SMALL TO SEE IT". Panel 3: Rock cairns at waterfall, text "EARTH IS MOVING, YOU JUST CAN'T FEEL IT". Flat earth skepticism meme mocking mainstream explanations.

item.title: Other 685
item.description: Two-panel meme. Top: Straight railroad tracks labeled "While They Keep Talking About Inertia" next to circular track diagram showing centrifugal force labeled "They Ignore Centrifugal Force". Bottom: Jim Carrey driving car looking stressed from Liar Liar movie, text "If You're Driving in Circles at a Steady Speed, You'll Feel it". Flat earth meme about feeling Earth's rotation through centrifugal force.

item.title: Other 686
item.description: Two-panel comparison diagram. Top labeled "SCIENCE": Water in containers finding flat level with green checkmarks for "Observable, Repeatable, Measureable", with cross-section showing flat water surface. Bottom labeled "PSEUDOSCIENCE": Water curving around globe shape with red X marks for "Observable, Repeatable, Measureable". Watermark fb.com/aterraeplana. Flat earth diagram arguing water level proves flat earth is science while globe is pseudoscience.

item.title: Other 687
item.description: Two-panel comparison meme. Top: President Richard Nixon on telephone with Apollo 11 Moon landing footage, text "Calls Men on the Moon in 1969, 239,000 Miles Away..." Bottom: Woman in pink jacket holding cell phone up searching for signal outdoors, text "CAN'T GET A CELL PHONE SIGNAL WHILE CAMPING IN 2017". Watermarks @flatearthmatters and fb.com/fematters. Moon landing skepticism meme comparing 1969 lunar communication to modern cell coverage.

item.title: Other 688
item.description: Black infographic titled "HOW TO TELL IF YOU'RE BRAINWASHED" with washing machine icon. Lists beliefs: Earth spinning 1000 mph, oceans curving due to gravity, ships disappearing over horizon proves globe, pilots don't account for curvature, sun is 93 million miles away, NASA's pictures are real, Earth is spinning ball without proof. Shows water/brain shower diagram with globe pendant. Watermark fb.com/fematters. Flat earth indoctrination awareness meme.

item.title: Other 689
item.description: Two-panel ocean horizon comparison. Top: Sailboat on calm blue ocean with flat horizon line, text "IT'S SEA LEVEL". Bottom: Same ocean image edited with exaggerated curved/bent horizon, text "NOT SEA CURVE". Flat earth wordplay meme emphasizing that sea level is called "level" not "curve" to argue water is flat.

item.title: Other 690
item.description: Close-up photograph of Jack Nicholson with wild gray hair and mischievous grin. Top text reads "INSULTS WILL NEVER TURN THIS MOTIONLESS PLANE" and bottom text reads "INTO A ROTATING ORBITING SPACEPEAR". Flat earth meme responding to criticism, referencing Neil deGrasse Tyson's "pear-shaped Earth" comment.

item.title: Other 691
item.description: Edited NASA spacewalk photograph showing astronaut in white spacesuit with gold reflective visor floating outside Space Shuttle with Earth visible below. Astronaut holds digitally added sign reading "It's all FAKE". Space program skepticism meme with photoshopped sign claiming space missions are fake.

item.title: Other 692
item.description: Digital composite showing Earth and Moon in space with security camera mounted on Moon pointing at Earth. Text reads "If Space travel was real, by now there should be a webcam on the Moon with a 24/7 broadcast of the Earth." FE matters logo and watermark fb.com/fematters. Moon landing skepticism meme questioning why no permanent lunar camera exists.

item.title: Other 693
item.description: Satirical space collage featuring Neil deGrasse Tyson in sleeveless galaxy shirt juggling planets and moons, NASA logo modified to read "LIARS", cartoon moon with silly face sticking tongue out, two astronauts (one holding "It's all FAKE" sign), multiple Earth images at different sizes. Text "FLAT EARTH MATTERS" at bottom. Credit JM. Anti-NASA conspiracy theory satire artwork.

item.title: Other 694
item.description: Two-panel image. Top: Photograph of Chicago skyline visible across Lake Michigan from 40 miles away, text "CHICAGO 40 MILES ACROSS LAKE MICHIGAN - AT THIS DISTANCE CHICAGO SHOULD BE 1060 FEET BELOW THE HORIZON". Bottom: Spherical trigonometry reference chart showing curvature calculations for Earth with 3959 mile radius, including drop table in miles/feet/inches. Credits S. Valente, M. Kahnke, Z. M'rabet & Brian Mullin. Popular flat earth curvature proof using Chicago skyline visibility.

item.title: Other 695
item.description: Photograph of laboratory test tube rack with rainbow-colored liquid samples in conical flasks showing perfectly flat/level water surface. Top text asks "WATER CURVES AND STICKS TO BALL EARTH?" and bottom text reads "SCIENTIFIC MYTH". Handle @nasa_is_lying_to_us. Flat earth meme using test tubes to demonstrate water always finds its level and doesn't curve.

item.title: Other 696
item.description: Six-panel meme comparing spinning speeds and reactions. Row 1: Playground merry-go-round at 4mph with laughing kids. Row 2: Carnival spinning ride at 60mph with woman laughing. Row 3: Motion-blurred spinning Earth at 1,040mph with group enjoying picnic. Flat earth meme questioning why high-speed Earth rotation isn't felt while slower spinning objects cause discomfort.

item.title: Other 697
item.description: Meme with physicist Brian Cox smiling, text "NO ONE IN HISTORY BELIEVED THE EARTH WAS FLAT - Brian Cox". Below: Grid of 8 ancient flat earth cosmology illustrations from Egyptian, Norse, Hindu, Mayan, Inca, Navajo, Hebrew cultures plus NASA globe, showing dome/disc Earth models. Meme contradicting claim that flat earth is modern invention by showing historical flat earth beliefs.

item.title: Other 698
item.description: 3D render of gray human figure holding chest with glowing orange heart pain area. Top text reads "When someone says the earth is spinning 1000MPH". Watermark facebook.com/fematters. Flat earth meme expressing discomfort/pain reaction to hearing globe earth claims about rotation speed.

item.title: Other 699
item.description: Classic black and white portrait photograph of Nikola Tesla as a young man, showing him in dark formal jacket with white collar, featuring his distinctive slicked-back dark hair and mustache. Famous inventor and electrical engineer often cited in alternative science discussions. Historical portrait photo circa 1890s.

item.title: Other 700
item.description: Halloween jack-o-lantern pumpkin carved with glowing text reading "the Earth is Flat" illuminated from inside, photographed in dark setting on porch or windowsill. Creative flat earth Halloween decoration showing carved pumpkin art with message.

item.title: Other 701
item.description: Facebook-style notification comparison meme on blue background. Top: "BEFORE DISCOVERING FLAT EARTH" showing minimal friend requests, messages (7 notification). Bottom: "AFTER DISCOVERING FLAT EARTH" showing 419 friend requests, 91 messages, 134 notifications with thumbs down icons. Humorous meme about social media backlash after becoming flat earther.

item.title: Other 702
item.description: Photograph of orange spirit level/bubble level tool held up against desert landscape with blue sky and clouds. Text overlays read "EARTH IS LEVEL" and "EARTH IS FLAT". Flat earth meme using construction level tool to suggest Earth's surface is demonstrably flat and level.

item.title: Other 703
item.description: Denzel Washington as Alonzo Harris from Training Day movie, sitting in car with skeptical expression. Top text reads "THEY TOLD YOU THAT WE'RE SPINNING AT 1,000 MPH?" and bottom text reads "AND YOU BELIEVE THAT SHIT?" Popular movie meme format used for flat earth skepticism about Earth's rotation speed.

item.title: Other 704
item.description: Edited photograph of rooftop neon sign against dark blue twilight sky reading "THE EARTH IS FLAT" and "THE BALL IS A LIE" in glowing orange/red neon letters on metal frame structure. Credit JM. Watermark fb.com/fematters. Digitally modified billboard/sign image with flat earth message.

item.title: Other 705
item.description: Upside-down photograph of black BMW car and its reflection creating illusion of car driving on ceiling/upside down. Text reads "MEANWHILE IN AUSTRALIA". Humorous globe earth satire meme joking about Australians being upside down on bottom of globe, questioning how gravity works on spherical Earth.

item.title: Other 706
item.description: Large street art mural on building showing giant hand in space holding syringe injecting flat Earth disc, with Moon visible in background. NASA logo modified to read "LIES" and text "REALISE THE REAL" and "FETAL SOUP". Conspiracy theory street art combining flat earth with anti-vaccine imagery. Real photograph of actual wall mural.

item.title: Other 707
item.description: Photograph taken from car on highway showing pedestrian overpass bridge with protest banners reading "Google 200 Proofs" and "NASA Liars" in yellow and red. Blue sky with clouds, trees, and "Regional County Park Next Exit" road sign visible. Real flat earth activism photograph showing banner drop over highway.

item.title: Other 708
item.description: Wide-angle photograph looking up at highway overpass bridge with flat earth protest banners reading "Google 200 Proofs" and "NASA Liars" attached to chain-link fence. Blue sky with wispy clouds visible above. Real flat earth activism photograph showing banner drop from different angle.

item.title: Other 709
item.description: Craig Robinson meme from This Is The End movie showing him with intense expression wearing blue tank top. Top text reads "I SEEN THE CURVATURE" and bottom text reads "I SEEN'T IT". Popular movie meme format mocking people who claim to have seen Earth's curvature. Humorous flat earth skepticism meme.

item.title: Other 710
item.description: Lightbulb illuminating tiled wall with localized light spread. Top text asks "IF THE EARTH IS FLAT WHY DON'T WE SEE SUNLIGHT 24 HOURS A DAY?" Answer: "THE SAME REASON WHY THIS LIGHTBULB CAN'T ILLUMINATE THE ENTIRE WALL". Bottom shows flat earth dome model diagram with text "THE LIGHT IS SMALL & LOCALIZED". Credit Nick Havok. Flat earth local sun explanation using lightbulb analogy.

item.title: Other 711
item.description: Dramatic sunset photograph over calm lake with mirror-like water reflection and dark clouds. Text overlay reads "Whenever experiments have been tried on the surface of standing water, this surface has always been found to be level. If the Earth were a globe, the surface of all standing water would be convex." Bottom text: "THIS IS AN EXPERIMENTAL PROOF THAT EARTH IS NOT A GLOBE." Flat earth water level experiment evidence meme.

item.title: Other 712
item.description: Photograph of billiard/pool balls racked in triangle formation on blue felt pool table with cue stick visible. Top text reads "THESE POOL BALLS ARE SPHERES" and bottom text reads "THIS TABLE MUST BE A SPHERE TOO". Watermark "Flat Earth Matters". Satirical logic meme mocking argument that spherical celestial bodies prove Earth is spherical.

item.title: Other 713
item.description: Cross-section diagram of Earth's interior layers showing temperatures: surface 57°F, mantle 3,000°F, outer core 7,600°F, inner core 10,800°F. Layers shown in exploded view from blue/green surface through red/orange molten layers to white-hot core. Bottom text asks "Do you see the problem?" Flat earth meme questioning how cool surface can exist above molten interior.

item.title: Other 714
item.description: Silhouette of father and child with telescope against starry night sky with Milky Way visible. Father pointing upward at sky. Text reads "LOOK, EARTH IS A GLOBE". Satirical meme pointing out you cannot see Earth's shape by looking at stars, mocking argument that astronomy proves globe Earth.

item.title: Other 715
item.description: Robert Downey Jr. as Kirk Lazarus in Tropic Thunder movie, wearing military helmet and smoking cigar with confused/skeptical expression. Top text reads "YOU CAN'T SEE THE CURVATURE BECAUSE THE EARTH IS TOO BIG?" and bottom text reads "BUT YOU CAN SEE SHIPS SAIL OVER THE HORIZON?" Credit JM. Popular movie meme format questioning globe earth logic about visibility of curvature vs ships disappearing.

item.title: Other 716
item.description: SpaceX photograph showing red Tesla Roadster inside Falcon Heavy rocket fairing before launch. Quote overlay reads '"You can tell it's real because it looks so fake, honestly." - Elon Musk'. Watermark @fematters. Meme using Elon Musk's own words to suggest SpaceX footage looks fake, questioning authenticity of space missions.

item.title: Other 717
item.description: SpaceX Starman photograph showing mannequin in spacesuit sitting in red Tesla Roadster convertible floating in space with blue Earth visible in background. Famous 2018 Falcon Heavy test flight image. Often cited in flat earth discussions questioning authenticity of space photography.

item.title: Other 718
item.description: Four-panel SEPHKO comic. Panel 1: Woman scientist at desk "THE EFFORT OF MANY SCIENTISTS". Panel 2: Rocket launching "ONE OF THE GREATEST TECHNOLOGICAL CHALLENGES". Panel 3: Satellite orbiting Earth "ALL OF THIS TO DELIVER INTERNET..." Panel 4: Man in NASA shirt holding phone "TO BILLY" who asks "Why can't I get a signal?" Satirical comic questioning satellite technology and internet connectivity. Credit sephko.com.

item.title: Other 719
item.description: Portrait silhouette created entirely from Samuel Rowbotham quotes and flat earth text about water finding its level. Dense typography forming human head shape against black background, featuring passages from "Zetetic Astronomy" about experimental proof that Earth is not a globe. Credit JM. Artistic flat earth text portrait tribute to 19th century flat earth proponent.

item.title: Other 720
item.description: Official NASA portrait of Neil Armstrong in white Apollo spacesuit with American flag patch, holding gold-visored helmet. Moon visible in background. Text reads "NEIL ARMSTRONG" and "FIRST MAN TO NEVER WALK ON THE MOON". Moon landing hoax conspiracy meme.

item.title: Other 721
item.description: George Orwell portrait on blue background with quote from 1984: "We often find it convenient to assume that the earth goes round the sun... Do you suppose it is beyond us to produce a dual system of astronomy? The stars can be near or distant, according as we need them." Citation: O'Brien to Winston Smith in Room 101, George Orwell, 1984. Flat earth literary reference meme.

item.title: Other 722
item.description: Dave Chappelle with skeptical confused expression wearing gray hoodie. Bottom text reads "WHEN SOMEONE SAYS THE GOVERNMENT LIES ABOUT EVERYTHING BUT WOULDN'T LIE ABOUT THE SHAPE OF THE EARTH". Popular comedian meme format questioning selective government trust.

item.title: Other 723
item.description: Serene photograph of dead tree in perfectly still lake at sunset with mirror reflection. item.title: Water Level 9
item.description: Simple logic meme with gradient blue background showing ocean scene. Top two-thirds displays white text in equation format: 'WATER DOESN'T CURVE + EARTH IS 70% WATER = EARTH IS FLAT' using large bold letters with black outlines. Bottom third shows photograph of deep blue ocean with small white sailboat on horizon line under light blue sky with white clouds. Photo credit 'Nick Havok' in bottom left corner. Presents syllogistic argument: if water demonstrably doesn't curve (as observable in con...
